title: Augusta County: James R. McCutchan to Rachel Ann McCutchan, July 11, 1862
summary: In this long letter to his cousin Rachel, James R. McCutchan writes of the beauty of the area in which he is staying, telling Rachel of a deep mountain lake she should see one day. The letter also refers to several people McCutchan had recently encountered.
keywords: African Americans, Arts/Leisure, Desertion/Leave, Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
